articles.author: Dimitri 'phaazon' Sabadie <dimitri.sabadie@gmail.com>
articles.description:
Neovim Core updates
Updates of Neovim itself, which are available on Neovim nightly.
Important: some updates might be missing from this week content. If you want to be sure to always keep up to
date with what’s going on in Neovim Core, you are strongly advised to have a look to these places:
@neovim on Twitter, which tweets the most recent news about the editor.
:h news.txt will deliver you with the last news inside Neovim directly.
Various PRs on GitHub.
Neovim Plugin Community updates
Neovim is full of active plugins. This section is about the community and what is going on.
Guides, tours, articles, etc.

      
    
    Dotfyle.com - Discover and share Neovim configs
  


Introducing Dotfyle: a website to discover and share neovim configs.
How does it work?
Sign up with GitHub and sync …
articles.title: 17 Apr 2023

New plugins

      
    
    backseat.nvim
  


Backseat uses GPT to highlight and explain code readability issues under each line of code. 
Run :Backseat to send the current buffer to the OpenAI API for gpt-3.5-turb…

articles.author: briandunn
articles.description:
~/.ssh/config add something like
Host prod.client
  User ubuntu
  Hostname prod-ec2-instance.example.com
  LocalForward localhost:5433 rds-gibberish.us-west-1.rds.amazonaws.com:5432
  IdentityFile ~/production-ec2-key.pem
pg service
~/.pg_service.conf save the user, database name, and password
[client-prod]
host=localhost
port=5433
user=rds-user
dbname=client-production
password=blablabla
ssh prod.client
pg_dump, psql, etc.) in another:
psql service=client-prod

warning

Well you just saved a production password to a plain text file, and now you can easily connect and muck things up in production. Make sure your machine is secure and be careful and stuff.
articles.title: Easily connect to postgres via proxy with service - #workflow

articles.author: jackrosa
articles.description: right-clicking on the file and then holding down the option key. You will then see an option to copy the file/folder's pathname.
articles.title: Copy pathname in MacOS finder - #workflow

articles.author: craighafer
articles.description:
Array#to_sentence that turns your array into a string in sentence format.
superheroes = ["Spider-Man", "Batman", "Iron man", "Wonder woman"]

superheroes.to_sentence
=> "Spider-Man, Batman, Iron man, and Wonder woman"

superheroes.to_sentence(
  words_connector: " or ", 
  last_word_connector: " or maybe even "
)
=> "Spider-Man or Batman or Iron man or maybe even Wonder woman"
docs!
articles.title: You can turn arrays into sentences! - #rails
